Description.p: A prescribed span of time when an education institution is open, instruction is provided, and students are under the direction and guidance of teachers and/or education institution administration. A session may be interrupted by one or more vacations.
A local code given to the session, usually for a session that represents a term within the school year such as a marking term.
A short description of the Session.
Indicates that the session is a marking term.
Indicates that the session is a scheduling term.
Enables sessions to be linked (e.g. link a marking term to a scheduling term)
The year, month and day on which a session begins.
The year, month and day on which a session ends.
An indication of whether a person is classified as disabled under the American's with Disability Act (ADA).
Official determination that the disability has adverse effects

A person having intellectual disability; hearing impairment, including deafness; speech or language impairment; visual impairment, including blindness; serious emotional disturbance (hereafter referred to as emotional disturbance); orthopedic impairment; autism; traumatic brain injury; developmental delay; other health impairment; specific learning disability; deaf-blindness; or multiple disabilities and who, by reason thereof, receive special education and related services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) according to an Individualized Education Program (IEP), Individual Family Service Plan (IFSP), or service plan.
Identity of Person Responsible for Eligibility Determination
A List of other names for the person.
The types of previous, alternate or other names for a person. Generally the "LegalName" for the primary name.
Results of standardized assessments used to document current student performance
Non-technical list of student's perceived educational special needs
Characterization of a deficit, disability or problem.

A description of the progress made toward achievement of the student’s progress on annual goals and if the progress is sufficient to achieve the goals by the end of the individualized program service plan.
Status toward achievement of the annual goal or short-term objectives.
Explanation for choice of other or information refining status determination.
The date parents are notified of the student’s progress on annual goals and if the progress is sufficient to achieve the goals by the end of the individualized program service plan.
Identity of Person Making the Report
Description of evaluation procedure and result used for determining eligibility.
Category of evaluation used for IDEA eligibility.
Explanation for choice of other or information refining type selection.
The date when the evaluation was conducted.
Identity of person making the evaluation
Categories of Disability Under IDEA
Explanation or information refining disabilty selection.
Analysis of the particular ways that the disability interferes with educational attainment
Proved identity of parent giving transmit permission IEP
Explanation of reason other than parent authorization that permission was given to transmit IEP.
Definition of the way we will know the student has achieved the goal
Insufficient Math Found
Insufficient Reading Found
Insufficient English Found
Visual, Hearing Or Motor Disability Found
Intellectual Disability Found
Emotional Disability Found
Cultural Factors Found
Environmental Or Economic Disadvantage Found
Limited English Proficiency Found
The type of address listed for an organization. Generally the mailing address.
The first line of the address.
The second line of the address.
The name of the city in which an address is located.
The abbreviation for the state, province or outlying area in which an address is located.
The unique two character International Organization for Standardization (ISO) code for the country in which an address is located.
A number that identifies each postal delivery area in the locale used as a portion of an address.
How the child's disability affects the child's academic achievement.
Facilitator Identity
The help this facilitor is asked to contribut to the achievement of this objective
Explanation of what the student wants to accomplish in life
Pointer to xContact object when facilitator is a contact
Pointer to xStaff object when facilitator is a staff member
Pointer to studentContacts xContact object when facilitator is a studentContact
The type of electronic mail (e-mail) address listed for a person or organization.
The numbers, letters, and symbols used to identify an electronic mail (e-mail) user within the network to which the person or organization belongs.
Plan has cost sharing available.
Government agency contributing funds to the support of this student.
The title or name of the assessment.
The topic category evaluated by this assessment
The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) location of the external Assessment Asset content.
A List of meeting times.
Information about the periodic days and meeting times of a section.
Determination that there is a severe discrepancy between standard educational attainment and student performance
Determination that student has not responded to intervention
Determination that this student is eligible for special education
Current accommodation Category
Description of specific accommodation or change made to environment
The number of correct results that will be considered to represent successful achievement of a goal.
The number of attempts representing a completed trial for assessing achievement of a goal.
The number of service events in a service repetition period.
The period in which the service events must be repeated.
Brief characterization of main change
Explanation of exactly what change is needed
Reason that the changes are needed
A list of enrollments.
Enrollment information for the student.
Information about the child?s ability to operate in a classroom or other learning setting
A network-resolvable Uniform Resource Locator (URL) pointing to the authoritative reference for the competency framework item
A human-referenceable code designated by the publisher to identify the item in the hierarchy of competency framework items.
Purpose within the IEP lifecycle for which the eligibility evaluation is conducted.
Explanation for how the student's condition meets the criteria for disability.
Identity of Person Making the Determination
List of the results of evaluations of the student
Results of one specific evaluation.
Indicates authorizer agreement to a document or plan, such as plan for delivery of student services, program, or improvement plan.
Authorizer's explanation regarding the authorization decision.
Information supporting the disability code ‘Team Override’
List of accommodations needed by student to complete assessments
List of issues where student is unable to meet relevant academic standards
Explanation of perceived strengths and abilities of the student
Explanation of the goals and interests of the student
Annotation of whether special transportation is needed
Explanation of the particular accommodation(s) needed
A list of staff person assignments.
The location and function to which a staff person is assigned.
Pointer to xContact object when service provider is a contact
Pointer to xOrganization when service provider is an organization
Pointer to xStaff when service provider is a staff member
Titles of personnel employed and contracted to provide special education and related services for children with disabilities.
The year, month and day on which the status of the service plan for a child is established or significantly altered.
The year, month and day on which the status of the service plan for a child effectively ends.
Evaluation Date
Brief characterization of main change
Explanation of exactly what change is needed
Reason that the changes are needed
As of version 3.4 hex values are not published with the code sets.
This element is deprecated as of version 3.3 and should not be used.

List of other codes or strings that crosswalk to or serve as translations of the Code element paired with this common element. If Code changes and OtherCodes are supported, both Code and all associated OtherCode elements must be present.
Description of the changes made to the individualized program service plan.
Description of the reason changes were made to the individualized program service plan.
Proved identity of official authorizing transmit permission IEP
Date that transmit permission was given by authority

A measure of average performance in all courses taken by a person during his or her school career as determined for record-keeping purposes. This is obtained by dividing the total grade points received by the total number of credits attempted. This usually includes grade points received and credits attempted in his or her current school as well as those transferred from schools in which the person was previously enrolled.

A measure of average performance in all courses taken by a person during a given session. This is obtained by dividing the total grade points received by the number of credits attempted for the same session.
The academic rank of a student in relation to his or her high school graduating class (e.g., 1, 2, 3) based on high school GPA.
Pointer to xContact object when external party is a contact
Pointer to xOrganization object when external party is an organization
Explanation of the role of this party in this IEP
List of specific life achievements desired by student
A system that is used to identify the organization of subject matter and related learning experiences provided for the instruction of students.
The actual code that identifies the organization of subject matter and related learning experiences provided for the instruction of students.
History List of Transmit Permissions
Special categories applying to this plan
History List of Amendments to IEP
Grade level at beginning of the IEP effective period
Explanation for choice of other or information refining grade level selection.
The procedures and/or instruments that will be used to measure achievement of a goal or short-term objective.
This is the root entity of SIF objects. It is the highest level object in the SIF Conceptual Model for Education.
Reason that student did not participate in this service.
The planned year or other description of the student's taking the course.
Description of content of the course.
The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) location of information about course content.
List of current accommodations
The RefId for the LEA Object.
The RefId of the school object.
The titles of employment, official status, or rank of education staff.
Discussion of the educational problems that result from the disability
Description of the overall changes needed for the student's educational program
Description of the accommodation needed to optimize the student's potential for learning.
Additional information that explains how to improve the student's educational outcome.
Pointer to school district or other Local Educational Agency that needs access to IEP
Service provider that needs access to IEP
Other person or organization (eg, court, prison, government) that needs access to IEP
Explanation of measurement process and importance of data that was measured.
List of accommodations to support effective learning
Indication parent agreed to evaluate student.
Identity of Consenting Person
Indicates the racial origins of a person.

Indicates the racial origins of a person. The possible values are: AmericanIndianOrAlaskaNative, Asian, BlackOrAfricanAmerican, NativeHawaiianOrOtherPacificIslander, White, DemographicRaceTwoOrMoreRaces.
Pointer to school or other LEA where this historical IEP was created
Period that IEP is in effect
Pointer to a person who has additional information about this IEP
List of contacts referenced in the IEP
Information for a contact person referenced in the IEP by iepCommonContactRefIdPointerType
Explanation of the primary reasons that an IEP should be developed
Parent's explanation of their interest in student's participation in special education
Student's explanation of his or her interest in participation in special education
Other useful information
A list of days.
Academic subject affected by this issue
The nature of the disability contributing to this deficit relative to standards
The particular ways that the disability interferes with academic attainment
Current accommodation Category
Description of specific accommodation or change made to environment
The percent of correct results that will be considered to represent successful achievement of a goal.
Description of other specific success measurement method
Restrictions for student and/or teacher contact with the individual (e.g., the student may not be picked up by the individual.
Indicates whether or not the learner lives with the related person.

Indicates that a person is a primary contact within the specified context, such as a primary parental contact specified in Person Relationship to Learner or a primary administrative contact for an organization.
Indicates whether or not the person is a designated emergency contact for the learner.
The numeric order in the preferred sequence and priority for contacting a person related to the learner.
A SIF RefId.
The full legal first name given to a person at birth, baptism, or through legal change.
The full legal last name borne in common by members of a family.
Time spent directly with the student.
Service provider time spent on other service activities that are not with the student.
A list of other Ids for the person.
An other Id for the person.
List of supporting resources required for student to achieve a goal
The root object of SIF Composite objects.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a local education agency by a school system.
The refId for the LEA.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a local education agency by a state.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a local education agency by NCES.
The name of a non-person entity such as an organization, institution, agency or business; in this case, a Local Education Agency.
The address of the LEA.
The phone number of the LEA.
A list of other phone numbers for the LEA.
A designation of the type of program developed for a student.
Reason student is included in this category
The root object of relaxed SIF objects. The refId for relaxed-type objects may be omitted. That is, the value may or may not be known by the returning system.
Name of Student.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a staff member by a district or LEA.
The login identifier for the person.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a student by a state.
Other Ids for the student
Address of the student.
Address of the student.
Phone number of the student.
Other phone numbers for the student.
Email of the student.
Other emails for the student.
Demographic information about the student.
Current enrollment information for the student.
Other enrollment information for the student.
Summary academic information for the student.
Persons that may be contacted regarding the student.
Languages of the student.
List of previous IEPs and contact information for additional research.
Documentation of existence of previous IEP and information about where to find out more information
Categories of Disability Under IDEA
Explanation or information refining disabilty selection.
A list of other organization Ids.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an organization by a school, school system, a state, or other agency or entity.
How the child's disability affects the child's functional performance.
A list of languages.
The specific language or dialect that a person uses to communicate.
The RefId of the contact object.
A person associated with a student.
A collection of information about a staff person.
Staff member who has a Teacher of Record responsibility for a Class Section based upon the state's definition of Teacher of Record.
A percentage used to weight the educator's assigned responsibility for student learning in a Class Section, particularly when more than one educator is assigned to the class section.
The telephone number including the area code, and extension, if applicable.
Parent/guardian explanation of perspective of rejection not specific to an element
List of organizations referenced in the IEP
Information for an organization referenced in the IEP by iepStaffRefIdPointerType
List of people who will help the student achieve this goal
Historical information significant to special education evaluation
Description of the current placement of student
Explanation of parent's observations of student’s characteristics and history used for determining eligibility.
Legal authorization to conduct evaluation
Education officials authorizing
Proved identity of authorizing official
Total number of special education minutes per week
The number of minutes per week that a student with disabilities is served in a special education setting separate from his or her non-disabled peers.
The number of minutes per week that a student with disabilities is served in a regular classroom with his or her non-disabled peers.
Description of status toward achievement of the annual goal or short-term objectives.
Parental agreement (or disagreement) with working toward this goal
The unique identifier for the locally defined rotation cycle date code when the class meets (e.g., in a two day schedule, valid values could be "A" and "B", or "1" and "2").
The day(s) of the week (e.g., Monday, Wednesday) that the class meets or an indication that a class meets "out-of-school" or "self-paced".
An indication of the portion of a typical daily session in which students receive instruction in a specified subject (e.g., morning, sixth period, block period, or AB schedules).
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a room by a school, school system, state, or other agency or entity.
An indication of the time of day the class begins.
An indication of the time of day the class ends.
A local code given to the session, usually for a session that represents a term within the school year such as a marking term.
The RefId of the school calendar.
Indicates authorizer agreement to a document or plan, such as plan for delivery of student services, program, or improvement plan.
Proved identity of authorizing parent or guardian
The date the authorization occurred.
A coding scheme that is used for identification and record-keeping purposes by schools, social services, or other agencies to refer to a student.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a student by a school, school system, a state, or other agency or entity.

This element is deprecated as of version 3.3 and should not be used.

List of other codes or strings that crosswalk to or serve as translations of the Code element paired with this common element. If Code changes and OtherCodes are supported, both Code and all associated OtherCode elements must be present.
List of circumstances in which the accommodation or change to standards or practices will be applied.
Circumstances in which the accommodation or change to standards or practices will be applied.
The description of the place where an assessment is administered.

Parent or official referring student for evaluation
The date of referral.

Name of alternative standard

List of other codes or strings that crosswalk to or serve as translations of the Code element paired with this common element. If Code changes and OtherCodes are supported, both Code and all associated OtherCode elements must be present.
Date that student over seventeen years old was notified of his or her right to sign IEP.
Description of the reason changes were made to the individualized program service plan.
Legal response and authorization to changes to an existing plan
As of version 3.4 hex values are not published with the code sets.
This element is deprecated as of version 3.3 and should not be used.

List of other codes or strings that crosswalk to or serve as translations of the Code element paired with this common element. If Code changes and OtherCodes are supported, both Code and all associated OtherCode elements must be present.
A list of student references.
A collection of person information that identifies an unique student.
Activities or actions to be accomplished outside of a service context
Activity or action to be accomplished outside of a service context
List of schools or other LEAs referenced in the IEP
Information for a school or other Local Education Agency referenced in the IEP by iepCommonLeaRefIdPointerType
A statement that describes the desired outcomes.
One or more statements that describes the criteria used by teachers and students to check for attainment of a goal.
A human-referenceable code designated by the publisher to identify the item in the hierarchy of competency framework items.
Parental agreement (or disagreement) with judging objective based on specified criterion
Objectives that will be achieved in the pursuit of this goal
A list of staff references.
The numbers, letters, and symbols used to identify an electronic mail (e-mail) user within the network to which the person or organization belongs.
This is the reference identifier of the student, for when the student record is expected to be retrievable. This is an alternative to the student though both may be present.
The date that the next evaluation is due based on the three year cycle.
The setting in which children ages 6 through 21, receive special education and related services.
The program in which children ages 3 through 5 attend and in which these children receive special education and related services.

The rationale for the placement decision and if applicable, an explanation of the extent, if any, to which the child will not participate with nondisabled children in the regular class and in the activities described in paragraph (a)(4) of CFR. §300.320.
As of version 3.4 hex values are not published with the code sets.
This element is deprecated as of version 3.3 and should not be used.

List of other codes or strings that crosswalk to or serve as translations of the Code element paired with this common element. If Code changes and OtherCodes are supported, both Code and all associated OtherCode elements must be present.
The specific accommodation necessary for assessment or instruction.
Description of a specific accommodation or change to standards or practices that will be made.
A statement of why— (A) The child cannot participate in the regular assessment; and (B) The particular alternate assessment selected is appropriate for the child.
List of courses that will be made available to the student to help achieving the goal

Professional occupation category or relationship to student

What the participant did with the student
What the participant observed during evaluation
Conclusions reached as a result of the evaluation

The date the authorization occurred.

Pointer to xStaff object when authorizing person is a staff member

Observations about the student’s performance in a practical learning setting

Intended purpose for sending IEP
How the child's disability affects the child's involvement and progress in the general education curriculum.

The code for the specific language or dialect that a person uses to communicate.
Portion the authorizer does not want executed.
Authorizer's explanation for rejected portions.
Anecdotal list of previous testing and evaluation of student's performance

A statement intended for use by education professionals, using professional terminology, to interpret learner needs based on the scored/evaluated portion of an assessment. This statement may inform Descriptive Feedback given to the learner.
List of goals that student wants to achieve
Documentation produced by people who have participated in the eligibility determination
List of goals to be sought for a special education student
Legal category for an IEP annual goal or short-term objectives.
Additional information about goal or why it fits this category.
Annotation of whether special transportation is needed
Explanation of the particular accommodation(s) needed
List of changes included in this amendment
Data pairs representing measurements of student performance relative to progress on this goal
A coding scheme that is used for identification and record-keeping purposes by schools, social services, or other agencies to refer to an organization.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an organization by a school, school system, a state, or other agency or entity.
The year, month and day on which the status of the service plan for a child is established or significantly altered
The year, month and day on which the status of the service plan for a child effectively ends.

Type of related or ancillary services provided to a person or a group of persons within the formal educational system or offered by an outside agency which provides non-instructional services to support the general welfare of students. This includes physical and emotional health, the ability to select an appropriate course of study, admission to appropriate educational programs, and the ability to adjust to and remain in school through the completion of programs. In serving a student with an identified disability, related services include developmental, corrective, or supportive services required to ensure that the person benefits from special education.
Indicates that services are provided to the child in a place where children of all abilities learn together.
The date on which the goal becomes active.
The date on which the goal expires or has been achieved.
The reason given for declining the recommended services.
Determination if this service continues outside school year.
A list of sessions.
A List of other addresses for the person.
The types of previous, alternate or other address for a person. Generally another residence or mailing address.
Category of achievement
Brief characterization of achievement
Specific details that would be recognized as successful achievement for this intention
Explanation of when this achievement should take place
The reason for the referral.
Label that assigns meaning to the categories that were measured (eg, x-axis label)
Label that assigns meaning to a chart display of a measured value (eg, y-axis label)
List of staff members referenced in the IEP
Information for a staff person referenced in the IEP by iepStaffRefIdPointerType
As of version 3.4 hex values are not published with the code sets.

List of other codes or strings that crosswalk to or serve as translations of the Code element paired with this common element. If Code changes and OtherCodes are supported, both Code and all associated OtherCode elements must be present.
The type of communication number listed for a person.
The telephone number including the area code, and extension, if applicable.
An indication that the telephone number should be used as the principal number for a person or organization.
Indicates the racial origins of a person.
The type of address listed for a learner or a parent, guardian, family member or related person.

The second line of the address.

A number that identifies each postal delivery area in the locale used as a portion of an address.
The types of previous, alternate or other names for a person. Generally the "LegalName" for the primary name.
An appellation, if any, used to denote rank, placement, or status (e.g., Mr., Ms., Reverend, Sister, Dr., Colonel).
The full legal last name borne in common by members of a family.
The full legal first name given to a person at birth, baptism, or through legal change.
A full legal middle name given to a person at birth, baptism, or through legal change.
An appendage, if any, used to denote a person's generation in his family (e.g., Jr., Sr., III).
RefId of the LEA
RefId of the school.
RefId of the SIF Student-School Association object.
The type of services/instruction the school is responsible for providing to the student.
The student's type of membership in the system.
The month, day, and year on which a person enters and begins to receive instructional services in a school, institution, program, or class-section during a given session.
The year, month and day on which the student officially withdrew or graduated, i.e. the date on which the student's enrollment ended.
The circumstances under which the student exited from membership in an educational institution.
Home Room number
The current grade or academic level of the student within a school.
The year and month the student is projected to graduate.
RefId of the counselor.
This is the root entity of SIF objects. It is the highest level object in the SIF Conceptual Model for Education.
Student who is the subject of this IEP

Measurement
A list of races.
An indication that the person traces his or her origin or descent to Mexico, Puerto Rico, Cuba, Central and South America, and other Spanish cultures, regardless of race.
The concept describing the biological traits that distinguish the males and females of a species.
The year, month and day on which a person was born.
An indicator of whether or not the person is a US citizen.
Medical reasons for determination that a potentially excluded factor is actually a disability
Other reasons that student should not be excluded from special education programs

A refId that refers to an instance of xLeaType object. The RefId points to the object instance.
A refId that refers to an instance of xOrganization object. The RefId points to the object instance.
The persons citizenship status.
An object or element identifier. RefIdType are immutable, and unique to an object in a SIF zone.
An indication of whether the student is enrolled full time or part time.
A coding scheme that is used for identification of a person.
The year for a reported school session.
The titles of employment, official status, or rank of education staff.
A refId that refers to an instance of a SIF object. The RefId points to the object instance.
The code for the specific language or dialect that a person uses to communicate.

The education level, grade level or primary instructional level at which a course is intended. Usage Notes: This element is repeatable for most use cases. Examples: (1.) SCED identifiers may specify a grade span of two or more grades. (2) A postsecondary course designed to qualify a student for an associates degree and professional certification could be repeated with both of those options.
A refId that refers to an instance of a SIF xStudent object. The RefId points to the object instance.
A refId that refers to an instance of xStudent/studentContacts/xStudentContactListType/xContact object. The RefId points to the object instance.
A real number between 0 and 1, with two digits of precision.
The nature of the person's relationship to a learner. The learner may be an Early Learning Child, K12 Student, Postsecondary Student, or an adult learner in a workforce education program.
The actual code that identifies the organization of subject matter and related learning experiences provided for the instruction of students.
A system that is used to identify the organization of subject matter and related learning experiences provided for the instruction of students.
The telephone number including the area code, and extension, if applicable.
The unique two character International Organization for Standardization (ISO) code for the country in which an address is located.
The type of services/instruction the school is responsible for providing to the student.
An indication of the function and context in which a person uses a language to communicate.
The type of electronic mail (e-mail) address listed for a person or organization.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to a person by a school, school system, a state, or other agency or entity.
The student's type of membership in the system.
The concept describing the biological traits that distinguish the males and females of a species.
The abbreviation for the state in which an address is located.
The login identifier for the person for the specified Authentication Identity Provider.
A refId that refers to an instance of a SIF xStaff object. The RefId points to the object instance.
The type of address listed for a learner or a parent, guardian, family member or related person.
The type of address listed for an organization. Generally the mailing address.
A day of the week. (See enumeration for exact values.)
The circumstances under which the student exited from membership in an educational institution.
A refId that refers to an instance of a SIF xContact object. The RefId points to the object instance.
Indicates the racial origins of a person.

A prescribed span of time when an education institution is open, instruction is provided, and students are under the direction and guidance of teachers and/or education institution administration. A session may be interrupted by one or more vacations.
A coding scheme that is used for identification and record-keeping purposes by schools, social services, or other agencies to refer to an organization.
A unique number or alphanumeric code assigned to an organization by a school, school system, a state, or other agency or entity.
